text: Give peas a chance
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: A recent natural gas find off Cyprus got a lot of people excited. @FionaMullenCY has been looking at the details and suggests that enthusiasm should be tempered https://shar.es/amZ2AX  #Cyprus #gas #energy
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: He hid it well all these years
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: According to @News247gr, Greek PM Alexis Tsipras was in favour of UK being given Brexit extension until May 22. Report also claims that during talks with Jeremy Corbyn before EU council, Labour leader told Tsipras he expects UK to head to snap elections in April
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Wuss
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: A third could be that it's less than 3 years since a sitting MP was murdered by someone shouting "Britain first"
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Ooooph, what a thought! I'm not sure there's enough space in the universe for another one
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Tired of the endless bickering in Parliament, the fruitless wrangling in Brussels & the late nights and weekends? I feel for you, but if we're measuring Brexit in Greek crisis years we've only reached 2012. You ain't seen nothing yet
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Let's not mention that this is what the Tories have been doing for the last 30-odd years
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Possibly. I never have any in mine ;)
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: The creation of an independent revenue agency in #Greece is one of the few big gains the country can point to at the end of its long crisis/adjustment process
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: At @IOBE_FEIR conference in Athens, Commission mission chief for #Greece Declan Costello highlights need for govt to step up public investment, esp by better absorption of EU funds, & for more FDI. Suggests where there are investment opportunities. Roll up, folks
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Israel, Cyprus and Greece meeting tomorrow. Focus on EastMed pipeline, with serious geopolitical implications. But does it have the potential to be anything more than a political project? @georgia_nakou_ has been taking a look https://shar.es/amJoXF  #Greece #energy
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Of course, then you have more of the same old shit elsewhere. The contrast couldn't be starker....
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Obviously there are more important things going on in the world at the moment, but maybe that makes moments like this even more precious. Fans appreciating a moment of beauty involving a rival player are rare, and this was extra special. Thanks Messi, thanks Real Betis
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Arsenal opt to Rennes-main in Europe
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: PM sends minister who's big on rhetoric & has high opinion of himself but little political experience/knowledge of EU to negotiate in Brussels. The result? "He was arrogant and patronising. Just a disaster." Hmm, sounds familiar
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: No. Because if SYRIZA loses big on May 26, it will likely be a precursor to a heavy defeat in the national vote. That's the main issue for Tsipras to ponder
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Speaking to SYRIZA MPs, Alexis Tsipras insists (again) that #Greece's general election will be in autumn, not sooner, & that his party will spring a surprise in the European Parlt vote on May 26, which New Democracy is expected to win comfortably
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: In its first report since #Greece exited its 3rd bailout last year, #IMF highlights areas where Athens needs to be careful. These include labour market (especially after min wage rise), fiscal and banks
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Harry would have UK in the single currency by the summer in return for an  unknown Portuguese right-back, a dodgy centre back from Slovakia and a has-been Italian striker. Bailout would be needed by the end of 2020
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Meanwhile, one man waits by his phone...
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: This is worse than Arsene Wenger's last season
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Hydra's a safe bet among the Argo-Saronic islands, although Aegina, Poros & Spetses are worth considering in that group. From the Cycladics, Serifos & Tinos are easy to reach and worthwhile
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Apropos of Louis van Gaal's retirement from football, this anecdote from @jonawils The Barcelona Legacy book is a corker
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Eurogroup passed on chance to clear almost €1bln in debt relief measures for #Greece yesterday due to some post-bailout actions still pending. Having successfully issued a 10-yr bond last week, Athens less perturbed than it would have been otherwise
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: I'm surprised they managed to find a photo of him where he's not falling over ;)
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Doesn't seem like our approach to firefighting has moved on much since 208
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Seems like such a tranquil place when MPs aren't inside
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: #Greece's population stood at 11.1 mln in 2011 but has been falling rapidly. At the current rate it's due to drop to 8.3 million by 2050, with serious economic & social consequences. It seems Greek politicians are starting to take notice after many recent warnings about this
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Germany is starting to treat Chinese investment with greater caution. A sign of things to come in the EU? @Jens_Bastian takes a look
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: By the end of 2014, Greece's revenues were almost 2 bln below the target & primary surplus was far from agreed level. But, sure, let's find some windmills to tilt at instead
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: All the best, mate
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Another one? You are becoming prolific!
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Also a handy advert for any fans who've been pulling their hair out due to recent performances
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Exactly the same thing happened a few days ago, when FinMin Tsakalotos was reported to have said he thinks a New Democracy win at next elections "likely" but he actually said the opposite. Further evidence of a systemic failure in some of the Greek media https://shar.es/am6w2b
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Gracious as always, Miguel
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Greece has to produce primary surpluses of 3.5% of GDP until 2022 & around 2% after that. But New Democracy leader Mitsotakis says he will lobby lenders to bring these targets down after outperforming on reforms in his first 6-12 months in office
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Uplifting piece on resisting "the rhetorical dope peddlers who are profiting from the culture of contempt" in our societies
author: NickMalkoutzis

text: Fox News’s propaganda isn’t just unethical — research shows it’s enormously influential, @mattyglesias suggests the manipulation of mass opinion by traditional broadcasters has a clearer impact than the fake news phenomenon we're fretting over  https://www.vox.com/2019/3/4/18249847/fox-news-effect-swing-elections …?
author: NickMalkoutzis
